elements.name: CAD
elements.title: CAD
elements.html:
Coronary artery disease - a problem with the blood supply to the heart, e.g. due to narrowing, furring, or blockage of the arteries or blood vessels supplying the heart - can cause cardiomyopathy.

Please select the following that apply to you:

elements.name: CAD.NARROWING
elements.title: You have narrowed or blocked arteries or blood vessels around your heart

elements.name: CAD.IHD
elements.title: You have ischaemic heart disease

elements.name: CAD.ICM
elements.title: Your cardiomyopathy is due to a problem with the blood supply to the heart (ischaemia or ischaemic heart disease)

elements.name: CAD.NORMAL
elements.title: The blood supply to your heart is normal

elements.name: CAD.PCA
elements.title: Had a heart bypass graft (CABG)

elements.name: CAD.STENT
elements.title: Had an angiogram and procedure to open a blocked artery or blood vessel to the heart (PCI or PCA)

elements.name: CAD.THROMBOLYSIS
elements.title: Had thrombolysis (clot-busting injection) for a heart attack

elements.name: CAD.NORMALANGIO
elements.title: An angiogram that showed the blood supply to your heart was normal?

elements.name: CAD.OTHEREXCLUDE
elements.title: Any other tests that showed you do not have any narrowing or blockage of arteries or blood vessels around your heart

elements.name: CAD.OTHEREXCLUDE.TEXT
elements.title: Please provide details

elements.name: VALVE_explainer
elements.title: VALVE
elements.html: Heart valve problems (narrowed or leaky valves) can cause cardiomyopathy. Sometimes cardiomyopathy can lead to heart valve problems. If you have a heart valve problem, it is helpful to know if it started before or after your cardiomyopathy.

elements.name: VALVE
elements.title: Have you ever had any kind of heart valve problem, now or in the past?

elements.name: VALVE_PRIOR
elements.title: Have you ever had any kind of heart valve problem before your cardiomyopathy, or been told that your valve problem caused your cardiomyopathy?

elements.name: VALVE_TYPE_EXPLAINER
elements.title: ValveType
elements.html:
There are four chambers in your heart and the valves make sure that the blood flows through them in one direction.

If the valve does not close properly, it will allow blood to leak backwards. This is called valve incompetence, or regurgitation, or a leaky valve.

If your valve does not open fully, it will obstruct the flow of blood. This is called valve stenosis or narrowing.

elements.name: VALVE_AORTIC
elements.title: VALVE_AORTIC	Your Aortic valve opens to allow blood to flow from your heart to your aorta, the main blood vessel supplying your body.  Please select the option that best describes your aortic valve:		1||Normal::2||Leaky / incompetent / regurgitation::3||Narrow / stenosis::4||Don't know

elements.name: VALVE_MITRAL
elements.title: Your Mitral valve opens to allow blood to flow between the chambers (left atrium and left ventricle) of your heart.  Please select the option that best describes your mitral valve:

elements.name: VALVE_PULMONARY
elements.title: our Pulmonary valve opens to allow blood to flow from your heart to your lungs.  Please select the option that best describes your pulmonary valve:

elements.name: VALVE_AR_GRADE
elements.title: Valve problems can be very variable.   It is helpful to know how leaky your aortic valve is (or if it has been treated how leaky it was).

elements.name: VALVE_AS_GRADE
elements.title: Valve problems can be very variable.   Valve problems can be very variable.   It is helpful to know how narrowed your aortic valve is (or if it has been treated how narrowed it was).

elements.name: VALVE_MR_GRADE
elements.title: Valve problems can be very variable.   It is helpful to know how leaky your mitral valve is (or if it has been treated how leaky it was).

elements.name: VALVE_MS_GRADE
elements.title: Valve problems can be very variable.   It is helpful to know how narrowed your mitral valve is (or if it has been treated how narrowed it was). Which of the following best matches the description of your mitral valve problem?

elements.name: VALVE_PR_GRADE
elements.title: Valve problems can be very variable.   It is helpful to know how leaky your pulmonary valve is (or if it has been treated how leaky it was).

elements.name: VALVE_PS_GRADE
elements.title: Valve problems can be very variable. It is helpful to know how narrowed your pulmonary  valve is (or if it has been treated how narrowed it was). Which of the following best matches the description of your mitral valve problem?

questionTemplates.name: cm_type
questionTemplates.title: Cardiomyopathy type?

choices.text: ACM or ARVC - Arrhythmogenic Cardiomyopathy, Arrhythmogenic Right Ventricular Cardiomyopathy

questionTemplates.otherErrorText: A description is required for choices of "other".
